Reviews.Title: A fair performer and a fair to good value for the price.
Reviews.Author: sh "sh"
Reviews.Content: A fair performer and a fair to good value for the price.As of June 2012 Panasonic doesn't even list this model, or any 24", on it's web site anymore even though it's a 2012 model. The move is to larger models (e.g, 32"). So if you want the smaller 24" size, you might want to shop around for price and buy now before these become as scarce as CRTs. This is a decent TV. Not a lot of settings but more than enough for most folks and the defaults will probably serve most folks well.The tiny loudspeakers sound like the tiny loudspeakers that are put in all these thin, low real estate TVs. This won't sound like your home theater system unless you plug the audio output form the TV into your receiver. Otherwise, it's going to sound like all the other TVs and laptops with tiny, tinny, loudspeaker.There is only one HDMI input so this might best be mated with a single BD/DVD/network-link player or game/movie-streaming device.The good news, it doesn't buzz incessantly like my Samsung znd hasn't committed electrical suicide like my LG.Btw, order your HDMI cable from amazon when you order the TV -- no point running over to, say, Best Buy, in the car at the last minute and paying $30, $40, $60 for an HDMI cable -- the Amazon cables that cost $1-$10 will work just fine.

Reviews.Title: Read the reviews and specs before buying
Reviews.Author: Garrett S.
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV during the black Friday lightning rounds. I was among the many that didn't realize the limitations of the TV before buying. Because Amazon has both the 24 and 32 inch models on the same page it is easy to misread what you are actually getting. Amazon should separate the reviews and customer pictures for each model so that people don't anticipate something that they aren't actually getting. I should have done more research and read the specs from Panasonic's website as well...That being said, it was a $159 set and I really like almost everything about it.Pro's24inch is 1080PGame mode makes picture much better (Picture is sharp and bright)Quite thinLow power consumptionCon'sOnly 1 HDMI input (thought that there were more because of the 32 in reviews)Picture quality and viewing angles could be slightly better (But then again, this is a sub $200 TV)NOT LED (Again the way that both the 32in (LED) and the 24in (LCD) are combined in the same page one would assume that both are LED, but unfortunately this is not the case.)So my advice to anyone considering this TV, buy it as long as you are OK with 1 HDMI and are looking for a 1080P panel. LED is missing, but LCD is fine. Good luck finding something comparable for the price, it's not easy to do.

Reviews.Title: Mediocre reviews for the 24" model are dragging down the excellent reviews for the 32" model
Reviews.Author: Liz
Reviews.Content: Please note that the star ratings here are combined for the 32" model and the 24" model.  If you separate them, you see that the 32" model is really quite a bit better.  I added up about 50 of the most recent reviews and found these average star ratings:  32" model: 4.7  24" model: 3.5Plus nearly all of all the 1 and 2 star reviews are for the 24" model.What this means is that you can get a really fine 32" LED TV here for an amazing price!The picture is GREAT!  I bought the 32" model about 10 days ago, on sale at BestBuy.  In the store, this Panasonic's picture quality easily beat out every other 32" LED TV on display, including the Samsung 4003 which was sitting right next to it and had a MUCH less good picture. It was also better than the Samsung UN32E5000. I've been just as pleased with the TV at home. The picture is clear, full, rich, but also nuanced--you see subtle shadings that the competition doesn't have.The sound isn't great, but it's good. (It's the 24" model reviews that call the sound "tinny").  The max volume is a little less than I would have expected, but fine for my needs.The TV is ultra slim and well built--backed with a metal plate rather than the plastic you see on most of the competition. I checked reliability ratings for different TV manufacturers and Panasonic still rates near the top. From the outside at least, this TV looks like it will last well.So far, I love this TV!

Reviews.Title: Perfect 32in. TV
Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: I identified this TV at the local electronic store.  Loved the image and it was the only one with a real thin profile.  They were soldout. It gave me the opportunity to compare this Panasonic with the LG and the Samsung.  While the latest were both brighter, the colors were not true.  The Panasonic was standing out.  Even my 11 y.o. son saw the difference.Pricing is very decent as well.Love it.

Reviews.Title: Best Color... Best LED TV for the Money
Reviews.Author: William  Mullan
Reviews.Content: Compared this TV to Samsung and Toshiba 32" LED TVs at BB. No comparison on color and picture quality. Panasonic stood out so far it was not a contest! Loved the 178 degree viewing angle which the others could not come close to. Bought on Amazon and had it in 2 days! Great TV and the remote has all the controls you need but does not overwhelm you! Don't look at the others, just buy the Panasonic. You can get a cheaper TV but you are wasting your money! You can not beat it on picture quality!

Reviews.Title: Great Picture - Great TV
Reviews.Author: Blake
Reviews.Content: I look at many 32" LED and LCD TVs but the Panasonic had the best picture and color of them all.  The sound is OK but I plan to eventually get a soundbar at some point.  The LED TVs are thinner than LCD so that means small speakers.  This Panasonic Viera TC-L32X5 was also the narrowest 32" TV that I found.  That was important to me as my entertainment / TV armoire cabinet is only 31.25" wide - many of the TVs I looked at would not fit.  I'm very pleased with this TV and would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone looking for a 32" LED/LCD TV.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic VIERA TC-L32X5 32-Inch 720p IPS LED-LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Allen H
Reviews.Content: Just received this tv today and it has the best picture of all! You won't go wrong with all the connections, the low wattage at 33.8 & the coolness of the back. Awesome in 720 or 1080 i or p right out of the box.I took my time in selection and after reviewing every 32 inch tv out there, I settled on this brand new 2012 Panasonic & you should consider this if in the market for a new tv.Peace

Reviews.Title: Excellent gaming set.
Reviews.Author: BC "BC"
Reviews.Content: So after a few weeks of research i decided to purchase this set for mostly gaming etc. I play mostly fighting games (PS3 at 720p)which are very sensitive to input lag and so far i am very pleased. Once i have the vga cables i ordered i will be able to get a proper lag test complete.All in all for a $350 dollar set it is a good buy. Colors look nice once adjusted and decent black lvls. The one down side so far is the audio which many have posted about in their reviews. Its not terrible ...but i would grade it a C at best. The 32' version has 3 hdmi, optical out, and a usb reader which will play mp3, mp4 etc.For the price and what you get...no complaints so far. If i can, i will upload with input lag test later down the line.Update: as promised i wanted to update some of the input lag info I did some test via VGA cables and was able to get roughly sub 16-30ms lag which is acceptable for almost an game including shooters and fighting games which suffer the most from this problem. I will attempt to ad the screen shot from my test as well in the photo section

Reviews.Title: Customer Images of 24 Inch VIERA
Reviews.Author: TV Antenna Guy
Reviews.Content: While I was hoping for two analog inputs as shown in the "Customer Images" - it still "like" the set, it works and has a great picture. However it has only one HDMI input, not two as shown in the third Customer Image picture. And has no SD card input as shown. I don't need these items but others may.There was nothing in the "Product Features" to say differently - so buyer beware.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic VIERA TC-L24X5 24-Inch 1080p Full HD LED LCD TV
Reviews.Author: William Shakespeare "The Bard"
Reviews.Content: The picture is outstanding. Viera has the same number of pixels across and up and down as the larger flatscreens. But due to the smaller size the resolution is far sharper for the eyes.The sound is not very good. But frankly, all these flatscreens have crummy sound even if they are four times the size of this Viera. You will have to have self powered speakers that connect with RCA plugs if you want to tweak the sound of this Viera.It is easy to tote around. It weighs like, I guess about 16 pounds if that.It can take a USB flash drive or SDHC card in a USB adapter and do your photographs. The video seems to be somewhat of anomaly. It can not do AVI files which I find absurd. The video must be for home pictures. The music playback at this point in time is a mystery.Got this for an associate. This TV has an outstanding picture. If you want to watch TV and little else this is a real bargain.Fast delivery with Prime. Good Xmas present.

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: Janet
Reviews.Content: I love this tv, perfect for the bedroom. Great picture!  I hooked it up to my pc, as well as direct tv and it works for both.  I have not been able to figure out why it changes from 720 to 1080 dpi...and it isnt the best choice if you plan to use it for a monitor for that very reason...but its a very nice tv!

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT TV
Reviews.Author: MaryO
Reviews.Content: I have an older and larger Panasomic LED as my primary TV and have always been pleased with it. When I wanted a TV for my bedroom, I naturally looked around but kept coming back to this Panasonic. It is perfect. Setup was super simple (used MediaBridge HDMI Flex)and the color is amazing.To improve the color on my non Panasonic small kitchen tv, I even used some of the color settings from this tv and the color was improved on that tv. My family have many different brands of TVs and after seeing them, I don't think Panasonic can be beat for color and performance. If it wasn't smaller, I would switch it out with my main TV in a New York minute.

Reviews.Title: Terrible Audio  - Decent but not great Picture
Reviews.Author: William B. Gavin
Reviews.Content: I have been a loyal Panasonic owner for years (currently have six Panasonic TVs and have recommended them to many others). HOWEVER, this unit is a great disappointment. The picture is not at all crisp (hooked up to a Direct TV HD receiver) and the audio is TERRIBLE!!! Fortunately, with my Direct TV receiver, I can pass the audio directly to my audio system. If I did not have this option, I would have returned the unit. Note, this TV does not come with an analog audio out, only digital, so your output options are limited if you want to listen thru alternative speakers.Panasonic completely missed the boat with this unit. What a shame!!

Reviews.Title: THANKS FOR NOTHING PANASONIC!
Reviews.Author: bernie baker
Reviews.Content: Bought this piece of garbage at Christmas at the same time as I bought a piece of garbage SC-XH150 Panasonic Home Theater. Well, the surprise is on me, they don't interface. I wanted simply to listen to the TV over the home theater speakers. Nope! Can't be done. HDMI on TV won't talk to HDMI ARC on home theater. Called Panasonic customer service. You have to order this cable that'll fix it. Didn't fix it. Called again. You have to order a converter but can't guarantee it will work. But if I move the home theater 30 feet across the house and hook it to my OTHER older Panasonic TV with the HDMI ARC hookup they guarantee it will work. Or they tell me if I hook a Sony TV to the home theater, it will work. Just not THIS Panasonic TV. That can't be, they can't be THIS stupid in Japan. So I bought the converter, and some more nice cables. Amazon is doing okay by me anyway. Sure enough, it doesn't work. So I have a brand new Panasonic TV and Home Theater and they don't work together. Guess what I will never buy again.... Anything Panasonic. Once bitten....But if you want a small TV that has minimal capabilities, and expect no customer service, this will do the job....

Reviews.Title: Poor tech support the real key
Reviews.Author: owen_colraine
Reviews.Content: I've always said that I would rather have a shoddy product with great tech support over a decent product with terrible support...and Panasonic is a perfect example. When my Panasonic TV arrived it displayed only a blank white screen when turned on, no matter what I did. After 90 minutes of confusing and sometimes outrageous (i.e. "no hold down every single button on your remote and count to ten....twice) they determined that it was broken but said that I should have it serviced instead of returning it. All I had to do was take my brand new TV that I needed for viewing things right away and drive it to a store 40 miles away, and then three weeks later drive another 80 miles round trip, just to pick up a TV that is by default now refurbished despite the full price I paid. They didn't see how this was a problem. Thankfully Amazon are customer service gurus. I returned this one and ordered a Vizio that showed up on my doorstep 9 hours later.So I know I'm one of those one star folks that throw you off when you're trying to decide on a product just because they happened to get the one bad one out of a thousand but...my review is about what happened after my TV was delivered already broken...not the fact that Panasonic sold me a broken TV to begin with.BEWARE.

Reviews.Title: Great Gaming TV
Reviews.Author: B.D.
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an affordable small-medium sized TV for my dorm room. I watch cable tv, blu-ray movies, and game a lot. So I needed something with good picture AND low input delay/lag whatever you want to call it. I finally found this 24 inch Panasonic and, after trying it out, I love it. It has great picture in my opinion. Watching movies is fantastic. For gaming purposes, this TV is top notch. I play many first person shooters, and I'm extremely sensitive to input lag. I cannot stand to play on a TV that has the slightest hint of input delay. At first, there was some barely noticeable delay, but I switched off some picture settings in the tv menu (A.I. Picture and Video NR)and that solved the problem. I am a very avid gamer and can confidently say this TV has no noticeable lag. Very satisfied with this buy!Also, I wanted to know this before I bought, but couldn't find it anywhere. Also, I had the Panasonic VIERA TC-L24X5. The inputs may be different on other tv sizes, but I'm not sure.The available connections on this tv are:1 HDMI, 1 component (HD component, not the standard red/white/yellow), 1 PC (VGA, not DVI), 1 Cable/Antenna.The TV also has a usb port for playing media files, but I haven't tried it out.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture
Reviews.Author: Truckerpal
Reviews.Content: The Panasonic VIERA has a great picture and the 24 inch is the right size for use in the kitchen.  The sound is a little tinny but you would expect that given the small size of the speakers.  Good TV for the price.

Reviews.Title: Good Choice
Reviews.Author: Java Lover
Reviews.Content: The TV was just as described. Sharp picture,great color and easy remote. No problems, easy set up, great packaging and handling.LED is better than my other LCD TV. No need for 1080p with this size. Very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Excellent 32" Flat Screen
Reviews.Author: CMB
Reviews.Content: I needed a new 32" tv and did a lot of research on Amazon reviews as well as CNET and other review sites. I have had plenty of Panasonic electronics in my time and have never been disappointed so after researching I settled on this tv.  I have had it for a couple of months and I am very happy with it. I use it as a bedroom tv and it's perfect. I especially like how thin it is, compared to the Samsung 32" flat screen that I have. It has good features and a great picture. I have no complaints about this television at all and would recommend it to anyone looking for a 32" at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Great tv at a great price
Reviews.Author: Gregory Scott
Reviews.Content: Amazing tv at a great price. 3 hdmi connections, optical sound output, super thin, light weight, and the colors are crisp and clear

Reviews.Title: Poor Sound
Reviews.Author: Lauren
Reviews.Content: This TV has a great picture quality, but a poor sound quality. With my cable TV provider I have to use the remote that the TV came with to turn on and off the TV which is a pain. This TV has a great picture quality, I just wish the sound was better. Overall I probably would recommend this TV if you have surround speakers.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Rey
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV during the black Friday lightning deals week to replace a 22" LG that I used both as PC monitor and TVPros:SlimLightNice glossy bezelGreat TV image quality in HD and even SD channels look goodSpeakers are good, you just need to modify factory settings, as they are set to 50% volumeCons:One HDMI input onlyNot full HD resolution using a VGA cable (highest resolution is 1366 by 768)Hard to get the screen to show 1920 by 1080 correctly when connecting the PC via HDMI: first desktop was cropped, then it had black bars on top, bottom and sides.Proper display was achieved by updating video card drivers and then using scaling option(My previous monitor did not need any additional configuration to display its maximum resolution correctly)Additional comments:The pictures shown in description are misleading, they belong to a 32" TV, which does have 3 HDMI inputsThis is not a LED TV, it is LCDBest thing to do is downloading its owner's manual before you buy it

Reviews.Title: The sound quality of this TV is simply unacceptable
Reviews.Author: Chuck Green
Reviews.Content: Took it out of the box, plugged it it, put it back in the box. To my way of thinking it's not that the sound quality is poor, it is that the sound quality is not worthy of a shippable product.I bought this 24 inch TV for my kitchen wall to replace a 10 year old Sanyo set and the Sanyo sounds ten times better. Who cares if the picture is decent if the sound is horrible. AND there is no way to hook up a set of small powered computer speakers as far as I know. The set has an odd RCA like "Digital Audio Output" port that the Panasonic tech swears is an optical audio output. Huh? Read the manual guys.

Reviews.Title: Simply wonderful
Reviews.Author: James Monaghan
Reviews.Content: Simply wonderful - very happy with it - wish I had bought it sooner.I have it on a swivel stand on my desk and slip the keyboard underneath when not in use.No problems with delivery - it arrived within a few days.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value
Reviews.Author: Thomas Hastings
Reviews.Content: I bought this to use as a computer monitor, and am writing this using it now.  I am very satisfied.  I secondarily use it as a TV, particularly when working online, as I can easily jump back and forth between cable TV and the computer/internet while working.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, sound not so great!
Reviews.Author: suncitysandy
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd 32 inch Panasonic TV.  The first one is 5 years old from 2007.  The sound on that is great.  The sound is loud at 11 on the volume control because the speakers are in the front.  It is a HDTV, however now that I don't have it on a cable box, I don't get HDTV.  The one I just bought the model from this year (L32x5)  is very slim, picture is very good but the speakers are on the bottom not facing the room.  I have to go to volume 45 to get a decent sound.  TV is on a cable box and I get all the high definition there is, so that is good.  It is fine for a bedroom, but remember,even if you are not hard of hearing, you have to put it up HIGH for good sound.

Reviews.Title: Bang for your Buck!
Reviews.Author: DMI
Reviews.Content: This television works great!!! I bought it as a gift for my girlfriend and it works wonderfull with her Apple TV as well as having a simple antenna set up for basic digital TV.  Definately worth the money and works perfect as a computer monitor!

Reviews.Title: AMAZING!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: KenW
Reviews.Content: Great price, SUPER sharp picture! Took less than 30 minutes from box to being in use! So easy to set up!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Dimensions
Reviews.Author: William Ernst
Reviews.Content: Please note that the dimensions that Amazon lists for the Panasonic 24" HDTV are not correct.  You can get the actual dimensions on Panasonics own web site.

Reviews.Title: 24inch has quirky 1080p, and suspect LED...but picture is solid
Reviews.Author: PJS_review
Reviews.Content: I bought this as an impulse purchase as a PC monitor.  As a name brand with HDMI, LED, and 1080p, I felt it was worth trying out.  My main concern was the confusion from reviewers which result from Panasonic's conflicting specifications (as a result of lumping the 24inch and 32inch models together even though they are significantly different.)1080p - Panasonic repeatedly identifies the 24inch version as 1080p across its website and packaging (box and manual) material, although slightly contradicts this on the website by giving the pixel matrix as 1,366 x 768 (this may be a typo, or intended for the 32 inch.) Anyway, the BIG CAVEAT on this is that the 1080p (if it exists) is not available for any PC hookups, even thru an HDMI connection.  (I proved this to myself by playing a 1080p blu-ray DVD thru my PC, and hitting the Pansonic remote Info button, which relayed I was looking at a resolution of 1366x768.)  Now the picture still looked fine enough, so if you are buying as a PC monitor and getting this TV at a price comparable to 720p competitors, then that's a reasonable way to consider this choice.  But as a monitor, it should not command a premium 1080p price.Now, supposedly based on the manual, if you connect a non-PC source (like a blu-ray player, or perhaps a video game) thru HDMI then you will realize 1080p resolution.  That's the part that seems logicaly quirky to me, since I personally would want a screen size larger than 24in if I was bothering to hook up those type of accessories.  While I'm sure some people like a 24inch bedroom or kitchen TV and want to hook up a Blu-ray player to it (although then you have to deal with the subpar speakers of the TV), I think panasonic's logic to restrict PC hookups from the 1080p means it really limits its audience potential.LED - Again, Panasonic makes this confusing.  On various websites including its own, Panasonic highlights the LED nature of the 24 inch (vs the IPS LED in the 32 inch.)  Yet nowhere on the box or in the manual does it claim to have LED performance.  So who knows on this one.  Again, the imagery generated from my PC looks fine on this "monitor", its just a question of what value is this machine worth when one is comparing it to other options which really are indisputably LED.So I'm debating whether to keep or return. (The HDMI is a reason to keep.)  So it will depend on whether I feel I really need a 1080p PC monitor, and what alternatives are available at the price point I purchased this at.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: This product is sooooo user friendly. I think it is a great product and I highly recommend it!  Buy It!

Reviews.Title: Perfect for Anyone
Reviews.Author: antwan smith
Reviews.Content: This T.V. is great for a small personal T.V great for deployment especially. That is the reason I purchased it. If you are a gamer you will love this T.V. I must say you gotta get a HDMI cord. Qaulity of the T'V' is beyond the price their asking so close this deal now while you still have a chance. If it made happy in Afghanistan I'm more than sure it will make fit for you also.

Reviews.Title: Nice Picture, Awful Speakers
Reviews.Author: M. Hickman
Reviews.Content: I don't use the speakers on this TV.  In fact, because the only audio out is optical fiber, I have to connect my rca cables to the DVR.  And if I want to watch DVD/blu-ray, I have to switch the cables.  This is a very bad design for a low end TV; to require high-end audio connection.And if I were to use the TV's speakers, I would probably have shot out the TV by now.  They are that bad.  Tinny and grating, I got better sound from a transistor radio from the 1960's.  Adjusting bass, treble, etc on this is annoying and only moderately helpful.But the video quality is good and I have no complaints about that.  The form factor is also very good.  I love how shallow (thin) the profile is, and the bezel is thin, as well.  I also give it kudos for the energy efficiency.

Reviews.Title: Great little tv
Reviews.Author: K. Reiter "KeiOsh"
Reviews.Content: We have this in our master bedroom, and it works great! Clear screen and comes with remote. Has hookup for HDMI. I also used it as a computer monitor for my Mac Mini for a while too : )

Reviews.Title: Super TV!
Reviews.Author: Elaine L. Martin
Reviews.Content: Easy to hook up to cable and other devices.  Great price, too.  The picture is clear and crisp.  This TV offers a lot!  This TV replaced a more expensive Dynex that bit the dust after one year!

Reviews.Title: Good!
Reviews.Author: Stepan
Reviews.Content: excellent  just one problem no input for headphones  and the volume is not soo great  but good price and the quality of picture is great  and very very reliable product  we use it more then a year

Reviews.Title: It's embarrassing but
Reviews.Author: Quiet
Reviews.Content: suddenly our old 25 incher was horrifyingly small! Good picture, but more to the point, I'm delighted with the A-P width! I know there are thinner ones but I'm just not that techy that it matters. The old one came into the house on a sled made of the old box and almost destroyed my husband and myself just getting it onto a table, where it darkened the wall. The only difficulty moving this one is the short cable attached to it.Great picture, nice and big, and I can move it myself. I'm a happy camper.

Reviews.Title: Narrow view
Reviews.Author: RF
Reviews.Content: In order to view the screen and get good picture you have to sit directly in front of the screen. Not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: Good Value & Easy to Set UP
Reviews.Author: Dick Ross
Reviews.Content: Purchased a used set at a good price, which arrived in OEM box with all packing intact.  The only thing missing was the power cord,f for which I had a spare, or you could buy for $6 at the hardware store.  The base quickly attaches with 3 screws and after powering up, the setup took only a few minutes.  Pros:  good picture, and displays 1080i with HDMI or component input.  Cons:  Does not display high definition cable channels input from the cable/antenna jack as some sets do.  I agree with another reviewer that the game mode picture setting produces a more vivid picture, so I left it on that mode.  Angle view drops off quickly as characteristic of LCD models, but you can use it for a 24" monitor, and where can you buy one at this price?

Reviews.Title: i love it
Reviews.Author: Alberto
Reviews.Content: is a small tv but with incredible clarity I think I like anyone who buys it will love it for its picture and sound quality

Reviews.Title: Good working product, but make sure you are being sold accurately.
Reviews.Author: Xavier
Reviews.Content: I have the following problems with the advertisement of this product:1 - This product contains customer images, one of them showing the back of the television with 2 HDMI ports.2 - The "Product Details" on this item contains a "Data Sheet" in PDF format that describes 3 HDMI ports.3 - Under "Product Details", there is another advertisement of this product, which states only 1 HDMI port.The information provided on this item is confusing.I bought this item believing I would receive 2 HDMI ports on the television.This is a problem that needs to be resolved within amazon and the sellers.I shouldn't have to be paying for a product and receiving something I did not expect.The television works great.  It has good audio for tv speakers and good image.  Everthing is in working order.I bought this item from Best 4 Best.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Asami Green
Reviews.Content: Perfect size for small room. It's crystal clear and easy to use. Panasonic products are always very reliable and great performance

Reviews.Title: Great little TV
Reviews.Author: Charles Guistwite
Reviews.Content: I ordered this TV (Panasonic VIERA TC-L24X5 24-Inch 1080p Full HD LED LCD TV) to connect to a video distribution system for my kitchen. The purpose was to use it to watch TV in the background while cooking, cleaning, etc. It provides a fantastic picture and looks good hanging on the wall (very thin and clean looking).I have also connected my Mac Book Pro via HDMI and it is equally as impressive. Text is clear and easy to read.I use external speakers for TV viewing so I can not speak to the sound quality.

Reviews.Title: Picture sometimes off
Reviews.Author: Laura L. Nichols
Reviews.Content: Great size for a small room.  Great features.  Picture sometimes faded, but mostly good.  I cannot tell if this is faded picture from the network that is off, or if it is the tv.  I own another 32" Panasonic Viera and have never had problems with the picture.  Panasonic is not making this size any more, so I am guessing it may have to be something in the tv size.

Reviews.Title: Good for a PC Monitor
Reviews.Author: Tball
Reviews.Content: The quality from cable is good on this.  I use it more for a computer monitor.  The best quality of this item is you get a lot of hook up options for a lower price.

Reviews.Title: average tv
Reviews.Author: drbwif
Reviews.Content: The picture is average , but the volume is very limited.  The max volume is too low. Would not recommend

Reviews.Title: Perfect for the bedroom or den
Reviews.Author: EWebb
Reviews.Content: I have the 32" version to say that I have been well pleased is an understatement.  This has a better picture, clarity,  & color than the 2 bigger LCD TVs in the house.Really impressed and will look to Panasonic when it's time to replace the others in the house.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good TV
Reviews.Author: Nate Adams
Reviews.Content: Works fine. Use it as a secondary TV in our kitchen. Only issue is that the speakers are not that great and for some programming it needs to be up pretty loud. Also the USB function only plays specific types of files. NOT .mp4's or .avi's which most of my downloaded files and shows are in. Ended up getting a "Micca Speck 1080p Full-HD Ultra Portable Digital Media Player For USB" and that worked out great with the USB connection.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic tv works well
Reviews.Author: roger cook
Reviews.Content: the panasonic seems to be ok, the color is good simple setup along with good quality picture and sound. I would buy again.

Reviews.Title: I Love It!
Reviews.Author: Eloise
Reviews.Content: Excellent picture quality. I bought it for my bedroom and it is just the right size.  I am very pleased with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV!
Reviews.Author: oneswtl8y
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV to go in my bedroom.  I don't have cable so it's only hooked up to a Roku LT.  The picture is very nice, better than the 42in Panasonic LCD I bought 2 years ago.  The profile is very thin and the set up was very easy. The sound in not too bad, a bit shallow, but considering how thin the tv is, I suppose it's to be expected. It gets pretty loud as well. The set is pretty and sleek. The bevel is decently thin. I really like it!!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic viewing angles. Great picture quality. Good price.
Reviews.Author: J. K. Paasch
Reviews.Content: Quick note about the set up of our room where this TV is housed. We have this set mounted above our fireplace, which puts it at about 3.5 feet above the eye level of most viewers when seated comfortably, and 9 feet away from the most common viewing angles in the room. It's in a low light room that grabs some ambient outdoor light, but is mostly lit by lamps.Likes:Aside from cost, and brand reliability, off-viewing angles was our biggest consideration when researching TV's. The off-angle viewing angles on this set are phenomenal. Colors, blacks, and picture quality hold up remarkably well when viewing the picture from most any angle. In that respect it really rivals the CRT TV it replaced and puts our Sony BRAVIA KDL-46EX500 1080P 120Hz 46-Inch LCD HD TV to absolute shame.Good color representation. The reds are deep and accurate. Picture quality is crisp, but not overly glossy.3 HDMI and 1 PC portThere are no extra lights left on when the TV is turned off (think power button lights, etc...). I prefer it that way.Slight Disappointments:There are two areas on the right side of the screen that exhibit some light bleed through. It's not the worst I've seen, and it's only noticeable when those areas are pitch black (think letter box).The blacks are very good, but aren't perfect. Very good for an LED/LCD, especially at this price range, but I wish they still made plasma televisions at this screen size.The bezel is black and glossy and a little thicker than it might need to be. There is also a small steel colored strip that runs along the bottom of the bottom bezel. None of this is overly obtrusive, but could annoy some people from a purely aesthetic perspective.Other Stuff:The remote is long and slender. It has just the right number of buttons/functions without becoming overly complicated.There are a fair number of tweaking options for the picture, but other sets in this range offer more choices.Sound isn't great, but given that the speakers are downward facing, it isn't an issue for us in that the set is mounted high and sound is pushed down.Final Thoughts:Viewing angles, colors, black levels, number of inputs, and pricing all came together on this set. We looked at other sets, and while the Samsung 4000 series was very good, even it couldn't match the Panasonic's very generous viewing angles.I'd highly recommend anyone in the market for a 32 inch TV give this Panasonic a look. It isn't a set that is carried by a lot of stores, but was well worth finding one for comparisons sake. We're very happy with this purchase at this time.

Reviews.Title: For games?
Reviews.Author: Alirios
Reviews.Content: Yes, this thing runs great and full hd is great for gaming and blu ray. Love this tv. I would recommend it. ^_^It has a variety of settings to play with like Game Mode, Vivid, and some other ones as well. Also has a variety of speaker customization options, but I connect mine from normal AV cables to gaming speaker set.

Reviews.Title: Darn good little TV
Reviews.Author: Mark Lambson
Reviews.Content: Repalced my 27" JVC clunker with this one. It fit perfectly inside our armoir.Good picture, easy to set up and program. Decent sound, not great...We have the 42" version of this set as a Plasma downstairs. Also a solid set.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: J. Floener "wire man"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this little TV to go between the kitchen and dining room. We like to watch the evening news while cooking supper, and this Panasonic TV works well in the space we have. The picture is flawless, but the speakers are a little tinny, due to the very thin design. It works great for what we use it for though.

Reviews.Title: Works well with laptop, not 1080p
Reviews.Author: Patrick Peebles
Reviews.Content: I use this as an office TV and as a monitor for my laptop.  It works well with the laptop and is easy to switch from one use to the other.  The picture is not 1080p but 720p.

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: Dolores
Reviews.Content: It is very light which is really nice when want to move it around. My old tv took two guys to move it around, so this really cool. It has really good sound and picture.

Reviews.Title: Compact
Reviews.Author: The Moe "modayski"
Reviews.Content: Tinny speakers. Nice picture.I bought it to fit in a small space.  At 24", its just right for bedroom viewing.Got it for $181.  A good buy.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased
Reviews.Author: C. Price "proud momma"
Reviews.Content: This is a smaller TV but has a wonderful picture. It was an excellent price for the product as well. Shipping was super quick, only took about 3 days to receive it! I'd recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: Panasonic VIERA TC-L24X5 24-Inch 1080p Full HD LED LCD TV
Reviews.Author: candi
Reviews.Content: This product far exceeded my expectations! I ordered it on a Tuesday night, received it on Thurday afternoon, set it up that evening with minimum  fuss, was able to sync it with the cable remote and was enjoying that 30 minutes later !!! Smooth sailing, easy adjustments and what a beautiful picture! All flat screen TV's have kind of lousy sound, but this one seems to be very stable. Most of the time you kind of have to adjust it during a movie, but this one seems to have a great balance in it, you just set it for movie when you first set it up! Highly recommend this to anyone looking for a second TV. Note...it is a lot larger than a 19" or 22" , so make sure you have enough shelf space!

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I was hoping for
Reviews.Author: sangiovese52
Reviews.Content: Exactly what I was hoping for, best investment ever, saved a lot of money, no hassle shopping, saved gas and time

Reviews.Title: Excellent 24" TV ! Low power needs.
Reviews.Author: Dakota Pickens
Reviews.Content: I Got this 24" HDTV TV to be used as an extra TV and computer monitor. I love it and would buy it again for other rooms of the house  if needed.  It has a great picture, features, easy to use and does not use hardly any electricity as compared to other TVs. Since the old CRT type of Monitors and TVs are no longer used here my electric bill has gone down. The energy guide sticker at BestBuy said it uses about $6/Yr. worth of electricity when used an average of 5 hrs./day with a charge of $.11/Kwh. Panasonic TVs have always been a good experience with me.

Reviews.Title: 24 inch panasonic flat screen
Reviews.Author: Eric K. Sherson
Reviews.Content: The color and screen quality is good. The remote comtroll need almost no writen instructions, it is intuative to operate. The sound isn't all that great but there are built in limitations due to the size of the product.

Reviews.Title: Good HD LED TV
Reviews.Author: Colin
Reviews.Content: I got this for free from Amazon when I purchased the 55" TV.  It is a great tv no doubt about it.

Reviews.Title: a great tv for kitchen,office...
Reviews.Author: J RIDER
Reviews.Content: perfect fit in kitchen, great picture, this tv came free when i bought the 55" model..very happy..packaging was great..no damage

Reviews.Title: Great value for the money
Reviews.Author: condomax
Reviews.Content: Good picture quality and so far is working great.  Sound is pretty good from built in speakers so I skipped connecting external ones.  If the internal speakers were amazing then I would have given it five stars.  No other shortcomings are evident.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Garys
Reviews.Content: This TV works as it is suppose to. No problem with set up and menu and remote are very user friendly.

Reviews.Title: bad news
Reviews.Author: John Buege "jackb"
Reviews.Content: Set functioned well for a few months and suddenly was unresponsive to the remote.  After a lot of fiddling, we got the remote to do everything but turn it on and off.  Now we have to do that manually and sometimes we can get NO SOUND.  Trouble started after 13 months, but we were away for 2-1/2 months, so the failure happened after just 10-1/2 months of use.  Of course, that screwed us for the warranty.  Now shopping for a replacement, but NOT A PANASONIC!

Reviews.Title: Horrible
Reviews.Author: pocketa queep
Reviews.Content: Terrible item. Sounds was always lousy--murky and low even when cranked up to 100--but almost immediately the set also started turning itself off randomly, sometimes once a day, sometimes every five minutes, and the only way to turn it back on was to unplug it and plug it back in. Stupidly I kept hoping it would fix itself and didn't get around to returning it to Amazon within 30 days. When I called Panasonic they were baffled and told me I had to have it serviced. I live in Manhattan, I rely on public transportation, and they told me a) the nearest service center was someplace in the back of beyond in Queens, and b), no, the warranty doesn't cover in-home service calls for 32" sets because they are supposedly transportable. So my choices are either to schlep it out to Queens on the subway or pay the folks in Queens $90 to come look at a set that I have no guarantee will do its random turning-off thing while the ridiculously expensive service guy is actually in my house. At this point I just want this piece of garbage out of my life.

Reviews.Title: It is 1920 x 1080p native resolution for PC and HDTV.
Reviews.Author: Jae Won Lim "FlightSafety"
Reviews.Content: I got mine today and it is not 1366 x 768 as some people suggested on their reviews. Do not trust their reviews.Some of them did not even purchased one and pretend they know everything about the product which they never tried.It is 1920 x 1080p native for both HDTV and PC. I tested with direct connection with PC and Coax connection with Comcast cable.Some people just don't know how to set it up as 1920 x 1080p native resolution on their computer. Too bad for those people that I feel sorry for them (I really do!).With remote, Go to Picture (scroll down to bottom) -> Advanced picture -> Aspect adjustments -> Screen format -> Full. This should give you full screen view of your PC.It might be difficult for some people who have never played around HDTV but if you ever used NVidia Control Panel or AMD CCC on HDTV before, it is easy.Don't forget to change refresh rate on Monitor Tab of Screen Resolution from Desktop to 60Hz as well as Screen resolution to 1920 x 1080 on your desktop.Then you can resize your HDTV desktop with either NVidia Control Panel or AMD CCC if your desktop looks oversized (overscan) or undersized (underscan).If you are planning to use this HDTV as PC monitor, be sure to adjust Picture Sharpness (depends on your preference) from 50 to 0 with remote when pixel/text look blurry.

Reviews.Title: Great picture and style TV
Reviews.Author: DaStaveman
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV online from Amazon.com. This television has the best picture that I have ever seen for a 32" LED. If your looking for a new TV then buy this one and stop looking at other ones. Enjoy!!!!

Reviews.Title: Horrible Audio
Reviews.Author: Linda Gooding
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for my kitchen.  24-inches was just right for the small spot I had in mind.  But this TV definitely does NOT do the job!  The picture is fine.  The audio is intolerable.  It sounds like people are talking out of a tinny cell phone speaker placed about a foot behind the TV.  None of the settings made the slightest difference in the sound.  I have a nice pair of Bose speakers that I used with my old TV, but when I tried to hook them up to this one, I discovered there was no 'analog audio out' port on this TV (the kind that headset jacks plug into).  I went back to searching Amazon and found an inexpensive adapter that would convert the digital signal to analog for my speakers.  (SANOXY Digital Optical Coax to Analog RCA Audio Converter Adapter).  The adapter works fine, BUT the TV volume control doesn't adjust the volume on the speakers and the mute button doesn't work.  In order to adjust the volume I have to get up and adjust the speakers at the TV.  If I want to mute, all I can do is turn the TV off (the speakers don't have an off button).  Also, there's no place to plug in a headset, if you don't want the sound to bother someone else.  Clearly not an acceptable situation.  It's going back and I'm getting a (larger, unfortunately) Sony Bravia that DOES have an analog audio port.  I think Panasonic really screwed up on this one.  It's hard to imagine a situation where one would want to have an amplifier and accompanying large speakers with a small TV like this.  I'm guessing the analog audio out port would have cost them pennies to include and it would have made this a fine TV.

Reviews.Title: Terrible
Reviews.Author: Konan
Reviews.Content: Terrible service, terrible stuff. I don't even know what happened to my TV. So whoever wants to order a tv, don't pick this one.

Reviews.Title: Nice smaller sized TV
Reviews.Author: HiroNotHero
Reviews.Content: This TV has good video quality for its size. Definitely the best TV, 24 inches or smaller, I have had the chance to tinker around with. The LED back light along with the maximum 1080p resolution makes viewing blu-rays and DVDs an overall good experience. Sharp contrast, rich colors, and vivid details are pretty amazing for its size class. Of course, it's not going to blow you away like a 40 inch or bigger HDTV, but that's a given. I would call this TV a "money saver TV". The speakers on this TV is actually pretty decent. They won't blow you away like a home theater system or sound bar, but they are very much acceptable. As for its visual appeal, it has a nice glossy black thin panel. The stand is small, well built, and looks nice. It's also a very light TV, so it's very portable and hassle-free to move from place to place. It doesn't weight like a bag of bricks, like the old "tube TVs" that were around before HDTVs. I'm overall very satisfied with this TV, even though I've only had it for a short time.

Reviews.Title: Not a bad buy for the money.
Reviews.Author: Sonja Tierney "~* Pixie"
Reviews.Content: When I bought this I am sure it said "LED" only and then after the purchase was updated to "LED LCD" which I suppose cannot be proven, but the TV isn't bad.... The picture isn't the best even with the HDMI cable but it is not bad at all. Easy to see when straight on, no delays, no pixelization or blur, great color... but there is no swivel, tilt or rotation so its kind of hard to see when sitting down due to the angle of the screen causing some dimming effects and solarization.READ THE DESCRIPTION there is only one HDMI connector and no RCA even though someone (not the seller) uploaded a fake picture of multiple connections.I really LOVE how lightweight and streamline it is though. It fits great in the small space available in my apartment. The sound is good but doesn't get quite as loud as some TVs are capable. All in all I cannot complain seeings as it was very inexpensive. I recommend this to anybody who doesn't need many connections and doesn't have a lot of space or money to put out on a TV set.

Reviews.Title: Accessory LED TV
Reviews.Author: Chirish
Reviews.Content: Decent TV for a non-critical TV aficionado. As I find with many LCD TV's, the viewing angle changes the image quality greatly. This one is no exception. When directly aligned with the screen, the image quality is above average. However, the sound quality and volume leaves a lot to be desired.  As everyone else has mentioned, it's awful and not well suited for loud kid filled rooms. Since we use it in our kitchen, it suffices for the cooking shows, kid DVD's and most often, background noise.

Reviews.Title: awesome lil tv!
Reviews.Author: Luis
Reviews.Content: It came on time perfect condition pretty easy to set up comes with instructions and they give you batteries for the remote!

Reviews.Title: Small Packages
Reviews.Author: S. Turner
Reviews.Content: It's small but it's fine for my bedroom. The price was really good. The only complaint I have is that I attached my FreeAgent GoFlex external drive to it, so I could watch a movie that was stored on the drive and it told me that it was not a supported device.Not sure why. But other than that, no complaint.I love the sleep timer too.

Reviews.Title: Very Good television
Reviews.Author: Jose Figueroa
Reviews.Content: It has very good quality and a great price, hope to buy a bigger one xD very good all. =)

Reviews.Title: Good Price
Reviews.Author: mmv
Reviews.Content: Good price for a television. The bottom is not as stable as I would have liked. Good extra bedroom t.v.

Reviews.Title: no headphone output
Reviews.Author: Sunny
Reviews.Content: does not have earphone audio output - only digital audio output - cnnot use my Bose hear phones on this one.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful great HD
Reviews.Author: Julio A Lopez
Reviews.Content: I Love. Enough for a small Room. Great images. Is very affordable small Full HD TV with the 1080p screen..I recommend it..

Reviews.Title: Good picture, fair sound quality
Reviews.Author: J. Davis
Reviews.Content: Good set for the money. Used as an office TV. Sound is marginal. Picture quality is good for a LED/LCD. I am partial to Plasma.This set is wall mounted and hard to view as all TV's of this type from directly below. A new wall mount bracket with a better tilting ability will solve this.

Reviews.Title: Very nice TV
Reviews.Author: Patrick Adrian "Pat"
Reviews.Content: Clear picture, easy to use and inputs for USB memory sticks for easy picture viewing.  Also SD card input.  I think the case looks very good.  The remote works well and is easy to use.  Price was right.

Reviews.Title: IPS display and 1080p output for a cheap price
Reviews.Author: tloppa
Reviews.Content: Excellent quality screen for the price during that time(probably cheaper now).  This lcd supports 1080p as I use it to output my Wii U.  The lcd hasn't given any issues yet and it has been almost a year. It got a low end IPS panel(hey it's better than nothing and it shows when I use it to view movies and games)dislike:2 hdmi connectors is better than 1.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic tc l32x5
Reviews.Author: COUNTRY GIRL "Linda"
Reviews.Content: I have been using this tv for almost a year.  It has performed beautifully. It has more av connections that mostlower end sets have.  It has a built in equalizer to control audio and various settings for video as well. I got itat an excellent price early in 2013 and would buy another if needed!

Reviews.Title: Color and sound quality are poor.
Reviews.Author: Donald Tomasso
Reviews.Content: We have purchased Panasonic products in the past and have been very satisfied. This TV is dissapointing due to the above reasons (color quality and sound)

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Picture
Reviews.Author: JIM PIMMS
Reviews.Content: My wife had just bought another brand, under duress, as she needed an immediate replacement for her old CRT set, and before I was able to do any research and evaluation of HD TV offerings.  A few weeks later, I, too, replaced my old CRT set.  After due diligence, I selected this Panasonic VIERA TV, based on Panasonic's reputation, the set's specifications, and the price.  Compared to my wife's set, this has far better color depth, richness, and rendition.  I'm extremely pleased with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: good picture
Reviews.Author: Nancy S. Gilbert
Reviews.Content: This is a nice TV when you want one for a smaller room.  The picture is great and the sound is ok.  If you want better sound, you can always get a sound bar.  I am going to be hooking this TV up to my son's playstation soon so that he can use it to play video games and watch movies.

Reviews.Title: Great television
Reviews.Author: Kristofer Pierson
Reviews.Content: We use this in our children's program, and it has been great. We use a drive in to display messages and slideshows.

Reviews.Title: NICE  TV
Reviews.Author: jez
Reviews.Content: REALLY  GOOD  BRAND AND  VERY GOOD PIUCTURE QUALITY I LOVE TO PLAY MY GAMES ON  TRHIS TV IS REALLY AMAZING  THANKS  JEZ

Reviews.Title: Worth your money!!!
Reviews.Author: EB
Reviews.Content: I love the Panasonic VIERA TC-L24X5 24-Inch.  It's great for a small room and priced just right.  The picture is clear and this TV is loaded with lots of functions.EB

Reviews.Title: Impressive small tv
Reviews.Author: AKN
Reviews.Content: I love this set and tried to find any reason not to like it, but I couldn'tI needed a small tv for our den, one which would be unobtrusive and fit into any small space available.  I also wanted one which was reasonably attractive.Since Panasonic is well known for it's spectacular plasma HDTV's this was a pleasant, though not entirely unexpected surprise, since I had read Consumer Reports for advise on which brand of TV to buy and they had the highest marks they have ever given televisions ever for the Panasonic Viera line.  I was happy to find the price was so low too for this model.This set looks really good and can be connected to anything pretty much.  And the main thing I love about this is the colors.  I am very particular when it comes to accurate colors and this is fantastically true to life, all the more surprising for such a small set.I like the design of this set very much.  It is glossy black and very simple without any big ugly logo or any other features to take away from the basic, elegant style.  The side panel has the inputs out of sight.  Even the design of the remote is well thought out and ergonomic.  I found that the menu is intuitive also and easy to use.For such a small size, this set has a lot of features.  I have hooked this up to use as a monitor and while I hated to get rid of my excellent Hp monitor, this one shows no downgrade in picture quality, and I can switch over to tv on it whenver I want.  The resolution is perfect and the monitor function works as well as my dedicated monitor.There are several picture options, and the blacks are deep and non grainy.  I have the black level set to light, since I want to see some detail in the shadows and grey areas.  There are all the expected inputs for this and it functions almost as well as any big screen set as far as ways to connect.  I actually can't believe I got such a high quality little set for such a great price.Buying any TV these days can be a big decision but I have had several Panasonics now and have never had any problems with them over the years.  I really love this set and it's perfect for a small room.  Even though we have a lot of windows, I can't see much glare or reflecton either.  This is perfect for my den and I'm really loving this great picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for bedroom.
Reviews.Author: Teddy Ann
Reviews.Content: This replaced a very old bedroom TV.  It was very much enjoyed while a family member recouperated following surgery.  Clarity is superb.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: K. Wagner
Reviews.Content: Would definitely purchase again!  This was purchased for use with a PlayStation 3 and the colors and picture quality are great.  BlueRay looks fantastic as well.

Reviews.Title: I went with a name brand....for a reason.
Reviews.Author: G. Dyjak
Reviews.Content: If you are like me and read up on a larger purchase, you will find that some of these no-name TV's do not last very long.  It must be the lower end components that are being used.  I have been with Panasonic since 2005 and am on my third.  My other two are arger plasmas.  I started with a $2500 42" back in 2005 and moved up to the flagship 54" Z1.  Boy, I wish they still made small plasmas, because I am so used to the wide viewing angle that they provide.  I have this mounted to a wall mount in my kids room.  The problem is that they are watching from a bunk bed at two heights, and the picture looks like hell if it is not in position.  Another oddity is that Panasonic is using down firing speakers in this unit.....probably to keep the bezel size to a minimum.  The sound is poor.  I found that if I cupped my hand under the speaker, it acted as a reflector, and the sound improved 100%.  I am planning on making two deflectors and maybe hot gluing them to the back.  Anyway, I expect this TV to last a good bit.  Stick to a name brand and save yourself headaches down the road.

Reviews.Title: Good picture, poor sound
Reviews.Author: Silvia C
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV to replace a tiny analog Sharp flat panel TV in my bedroom.  The 32" Viera was the smallest one I could find with a decent viewing angle needed to place this on top of my dresser and still be seen when I'm doing yoga on the bedroom floor.  So I really didn't have much choice, but I can't say I'm happy.Pros:- Decent picture, I don't really need 1080p in the bedroom, the 780p is good enough.- The viewing angle is good, although not as good as the old Sharp flat screen it was replacing (surprised me too).- Easy to assemble and set up, was up and running quickly.Cons:- The sound really is not all that good.  It is noticeable worse than the tiny Sharp TV it replaced. I'll repeat that.  It sounds worse than a small 10-year-old TV.- No RCA sound output- No headset output- Soundbars and speakers are all still analog, and won't accept the digital optical sound output, so unless you are using this with a home theater system or receiver (not likely in a bedroom), you are out of luck if you want better sound than the TV provides.Bottom line, good TV for the size if you're using with a sound receiver or if you don't care about sound that much.

Reviews.Title: Perfect television for the bedroom.
Reviews.Author: Barry K. Smith
Reviews.Content: Excellent picture, and the different inputs are great. Though there were comments about the sound in other reviews, I found the sound to be satisfactory for the size of the television.

Reviews.Title: Clock info for shows is always off
Reviews.Author: D. Nelson
Reviews.Content: This monitor/HDTV would have been better if it came with drivers for the monitor portion as it uses the plug and play drivers as default.  My computer is older so the resolution suffered because of a antiquated graphics card.  Screwing around trying to find some drivers for it helped.  I still should have been able to get 1280 x 1024 instead of the 1024 x 768 numbers it set it up as. I do get the 1280 x 1024 resolution after I installed a Windows generic Digital Flat Panel display driver. As a result, I have black bars on both sides of my screen.  So, it looks like the 4:3 aspect ratio of old monitor screens and not the 16 x 9 aspect ratio.  That is fine with me.  Including drivers would have helped, or at the very least on your website.  Before installing the Windows driver, had problems with sharpness of details.  I would say now, things look decent enough.  Make sure to use the auto adjust for sharpness.  This is located on page 2 under PC adjustments.TV is pretty good picture.  Sometimes I wonder if any company ever practices quality control as the time for the shows is always off and there is no way to adjust time through the menu.  Let's say you are watching Wheel of Fortune.  It comes on at 6:30 pm around here.  When you press the info button, or change the channel, it will say Wheel of Fortune 7:30-8:00 pm.  Any show is one hour ahead.  Even when daylight saving time began, the times must have increased one hour also.  Because of the time differential, I have seen it report the wrong show you are watching also.  Most of the time though it gets the show correct, just the time is wrong.  Wrote customer service about issue, it is like they care.  Sorry they say.  With the tv picture I get the full 16 x 9 aspect ratio, unless the show is being broadcast not being able to fill the whole screen. I pick up my shows over the air (broadcast).This is their actual response I got back from their customer service regarding this issue:  Thank you for your inquiry. Based on the research that I have conducted, there does not seem to be a time setting in this unit. There is a timer setting for the TV set. We do apologize for the inconvenience this might cause. Thank you for contacting Panasonic.Miss the PIP of my old set.  But this will suffice for now.

Reviews.Title: yet another amazon bargain!
Reviews.Author: Timster52
Reviews.Content: Works great...just wish the packaging/owners manual would say more about the LED feature.  Does not mention it once.  Almost sent it back thinking it cannot be LED...had to verify it on Panasonic's website.  As they say.....if it ain't LED, you don't want it!!!

Reviews.Title: Good screen
Reviews.Author: M. MARTINEZ "Librarian"
Reviews.Content: This is a good screen, but I didn't understand measurements so this is smaller than I wanted, but bigger than I had. I wanted this to be a TV screen, but really it's just a larger monitor.

Reviews.Title: Great picture!
Reviews.Author: C E H
Reviews.Content: This television has a great picture.  Just the size needed for a smaller bedroom.  Hook up was easy for a novice.

Reviews.Title: Great Tv
Reviews.Author: Peter
Reviews.Content: Great Tv for the price. Easy to setup. The picture is just as good as on my panasonic viera 42" plasma tv. The audio is ok for the tiny speakers. Good for my bedroom. Much better than the 20" tube tv.

Reviews.Title: Good T.V. for the price
Reviews.Author: Kathi Kralicek
Reviews.Content: This T.V. is good for someone who is short on funds. Has a good picture with great color. Was very easy to hook up to everything else I have.

Reviews.Title: Perfect For The Bedroom
Reviews.Author: John Carlton "actingman"
Reviews.Content: More HDMI ports than I need.  USB port to read movie files on a stick.  Card slot for photos.  RCA jacks for the DVD and the VCR.  Computer input to run the laptop.  It is all here.  I also find that the tuner is more sensitive to what the antenna is bringing in than the previous converter box was on the CRT TV this Panasonic replaced...in other words, it is reading more channels.  The picture is fine, the sound is fine.  I have a Panasonic Viera 42 inch 1080 in the living room, and it was on that basis that I choose this model for the bedroom.  I am completely satisfied.

Reviews.Title: GOOD GOOD GOOD!!!
Reviews.Author: Carlos Salazar
Reviews.Content: The TV is in our opinion one of the best if not the best option for a TV of lower-middle range. This model is available in smaller screen sizes: 32, 37 and 42 inches. The technical characteristics are good for this level teelvisor a good Smart TV with flash support, and good play by USB

Reviews.Title: Picture good
Reviews.Author: Billy D. Sanderson
Reviews.Content: The picture on this set is good. The sound leaves much to be desired. I bought it so I could watch TV while walking on tread mill but can not hear it above the sound of tread mill

Reviews.Title: A Good Buy -- If Inaccurate Skin Tones Don't Bother You
Reviews.Author: PAUL ZURICH
Reviews.Content: All features above average except for skin tones, which appear "pasty" and somewhat shiny.  Adjustments to color intensity and tone proved fruitless, although selecting "Movie Mode" did reduce the condition a bit.

Reviews.Title: Its a TV
Reviews.Author: DAD
Reviews.Content: Great price... works great... easy to use... hook up my Xoom, computer and stuff  great price more words more words

Reviews.Title: Panasonic v. tv went out after 1yr 4mon.
Reviews.Author: babemalo
Reviews.Content: Bought this tv elsewhere, but after a year and a few months, it went out on me. The power button cuts on, but there is no picture, its completely black. And when i try to turn it off, it wont cut off, the red power button stays on, unless i unplug.---- Im not the only person who has had this exact problem with the Panasonic Viera tv. Panasonic really needs to check this out, & make better tvs. Called around & everyone told me I'd have to pay a $49 diagnostic fee, +plus 100+ to get it fixed. If thats the case I might as well buy a new tv, they run for $199-300. I'm not going to buy a new tv every 2 years just because they make bad quality tvs. If thats the case i can go back the fat screens that lasted 15 years.** ATTENTION Panasonic fix this!Til then i'll stick with another brand.

Reviews.Title: Sound was not good
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Noone
Reviews.Content: The picture was fine however the sound was horrible, sounded like a tin can and no headphone jack to support external speakers.  Returned it....

Reviews.Title: Good picture
Reviews.Author: Norma J Womack
Reviews.Content: I like my set very much except for the amount of volume produced by the speakers.the sound comes out of the bottom of the set and seems to be absorbed by the stand It is presently sitting on.  I do not find outlets for external speakers except a rather pricy sound system.  I intend to order a wall bracker for the set and hope not having the set sitting on a cabinet will remedy the problem.. Other than that I am very happy with my choice.I would recommend this set to anyone when it comes to price, quality of picture and apperance.  As far as I am concerned the jury is still out regarding the clear but less than adequate sound production.

Reviews.Title: Excelente televisor
Reviews.Author: Ruben Vega
Reviews.Content: Excelente producto, esLiviano, es facil cambiar el formato de la imagen con el control remoto.Consume poca electricidad, espesor de 8 cms,

Reviews.Title: Really good little TV
Reviews.Author: William Dietsch
Reviews.Content: I bought this for use in our bedroom after our old crt died.  Picture is sharp and sound is fine for such little speakers.  For the price, it can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Abdias Carmona
Reviews.Content: I like it very much. The TV just has all the features that I was looking for. I would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Good picture quality, works well.
Reviews.Author: Jim Marshall
Reviews.Content: The 24 inch Panasonic TV was actually purchased for a computer monitor, but have it connected to a Dish receiver for TV when not being used as monitor. Only problem with it is that the Horizontal width is wider than the actual screen. (Overscan). An example is that when watching football playoffs, the game score in the upper left hand portion of the display was partially blocked, so couldn't tell which team had which score. A call to Panasonic service said this was factory set, and not adjustable. So, guess I will live with it. Otherwise, certainly meets my requirements.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: DAH
Reviews.Content: So far so good.  The tv does its job and is working great so far.  My only complaint is that it doesn't have an alarm setting to turn on at a set time.

Reviews.Title: Good for Office/Spare Room
Reviews.Author: CW
Reviews.Content: Needed a small set for my home/office.  This size was perfect.  I did read prior reviews on the issues if this not being full HD.  But, for the holiday season lightening deal price it was still to good pass up as this is not my primary TV, but perfect for the home/office.By far NOT the best Panny product, but rather have this than some off brand no name TV with worse quality withing the price range.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic has outdone itself in value and feature
Reviews.Author: Sajid G. Mulla
Reviews.Content: The TV has great picture and a wide array of input the price and size is acceptable in this range. The color and options are great and the wide array of inputs make this a keeper for the bedroom.If you want a larger size then your probably will not look at this product anyways if I was to purchase a TV it would be this or a Samsung and I am currently using a Samsung as my primary HTPC and TV in my room.

Reviews.Title: Replaced 26" Viera
Reviews.Author: Michiglenn
Reviews.Content: I would rate it higher but the sound quality just isn't as good as it should be for a Panasonic.

Reviews.Title: NOT LED
Reviews.Author: Richard_Colosimo
Reviews.Content: How dare it be advertised as an LED TV when it isn't. The tv works well but I wouldn't have paid that much if I had known it was only a LCD.

Reviews.Title: Poor picture
Reviews.Author: Annis H Reichow
Reviews.Content: Doe's not come close to the picture or soundon the Philips ..  Very weak mounting base..Don't know why they can't use the space at the left andright of the base to put in decent size speakers...

Reviews.Title: Great price and a good TV.
Reviews.Author: J. K. Harris "K Harris"
Reviews.Content: This TV is really easy to setup. The picture is good. Great price too. I set this TV in my bed room. It is a good fit.

Reviews.Title: Xmas gift to a grandson!
Reviews.Author: Bob "Grasshopper"
Reviews.Content: He reports a great picture and the sound has very good volume and clarity.  His only complaint was that it only has one HDMI input and when he hooks up his PS3 with composite cables the colors are the wrong tint and he couldn't make them right with the TV's menu.  It helped, but never as good as when he uses the HDMI input.  He bought the PS3 as a used machine and he admits it could be a PS3 problem.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product for my requirement and price point
Reviews.Author: BMD_Kole
Reviews.Content: Excellent product for my requirement and price point; can't be much happier! Purchased the TV because of the great experience/satisfaction I've had with my Panasonic 42"  ET5.

Reviews.Title: My parents LOVE this TV.
Reviews.Author: James Tyler
Reviews.Content: I chose this rating by the sheer approval my parents gave this TV. The quality of the picture is beyond adequate for what they're using it for. They have placed it in their camper. The lighting the screen emits is very vibrant and the colors show up very well. Blu-Ray's and DVD's look great. The audio is above what i expected from a 24-Inch TV. I tested it with First-Person Shooters on the Xbox 360 and it was topnotch. The size of the hardware is slim and fits perfectly in their cubbyhole they've set it up in. It stands sturdy and hasn't fallen over while they've moved the camper from camp ground to camp ground. I'd suggest this TV for anyone who wants a solid unit!Hope this helps someone out there!

Reviews.Title: Nice picture. So-so sound.
Reviews.Author: Neera "Graphic Designer"
Reviews.Content: Sound:The speaker is in the back of the TV. I have it wall mounted with an extendable arm, and regularly have trouble hearing anything with it against the wall. If I pull it out, it's still "tinny" and hollow. I can't listen to music shows through it - it's just terrible sound. For regular programming, it's OK if you turn the sound WAY UP. In summary: A sound bar is now on my wish list.Picture: Beautiful, crisp picture. Bright vivid color. Love it.Remote:Nice layout, easy to get to the right button. Pleasantly surprised to have a functional remote.Nice Added Features:You can label your inputs - nice if you have a lot of HDMI cables going into this thing. Also, you can save favorite channels for quick, easy access. My 42" can't do that.Game Mode:I bought the 32" Panasonic LED TV after looking for ages for a TV this size with a game mode. As an avid gamer (I particularly love to play DDR), lag can really kill your game. This feature has not disappointed! While it's not entirely lag free for DDR, it's substantially better than my other LCD television. I think it won't get any better unless you stick to a tube-tv or projector.PC via HDMI input:My husband and I are pretty tech-saavy, but we can't seem to get the TV to show the right resolution when we plug in our computer to this thing. Full-screen mode still works fine if you're watching a streaming show, but it can be frustrating to get your bottom toolbars to show. I usually do it as a 2nd/extended desktop to make it easier, but it's still not as perfect as I'd hoped. We don't have this same issue with  our 42" TV.In summary:Game mode and picture = greatSound = mediocre

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Nancy E Socha
Reviews.Content: Perfect size for my kitchen!  I could watch the Food Network while I made Christmas dinner!  Great picture and sound.

Reviews.Title: great TV
Reviews.Author: shayna
Reviews.Content: love the picture and it arrives super fast and in excellent condition! only thing is the volume accelerated very slow it takes almost 10 numeral diffrence for it to be much louder but i have no problem with that i can get better surround.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic VIERA TC-L24X5  - Best one by far!
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: After previously purchasing a $1800 Panasonic 60" HD 3D TV with all the bells and whistles a month ago I decided to get this smaller 24" Panasonic. I must say the picture on this is just as good as my $1800 one. I also had bought my 1st Panasonic for my son about 3 years ago and it's good as the day I bought it. The Picture on these Panasonic's is 1st to none along with the top ratings these Panasonic's have. I could have got a different brand TV at a lower price but this will outlast the others and has the best pictures by far. I would highly recommend this to anyone.Just remember you get what you pay for. Spend a few bucks more and get this one!

Reviews.Title: GREAT
Reviews.Author: Robert E. Green
Reviews.Content: i LIKE THE STYLE, PICTURE AND THE QUALITY OF THE HIGH DEFINITION. It was easy to set up and view.

Reviews.Title: TV is perfect for my requirements
Reviews.Author: TTYler
Reviews.Content: Nice size TV with great resolution and color.  Easy to setup and operate. Sound was fine for a 12x15 room.

Reviews.Title: Good Picture
Reviews.Author: Tracy  Stanton
Reviews.Content: I like this television just fine. As with all the televisions these days (because they want you to buy a sound bar or speakers) the audio lacks! I can hardly hear it and had to hook up speakers to get a good sound quality!

Reviews.Title: Good Purchase
Reviews.Author: Sj1
Reviews.Content: Nice clear picture - easy set up, lightweight  compact - purchased this TV on Black Friday so was extra pleased with the price

Reviews.Title: Needs better sound
Reviews.Author: Erik
Reviews.Content: The picture is good and the tv menu is easy to use. The remote is a bit sensitive but no biggy. The sound though could really use some depth, it's very treble. Even after boosting the bass and/or dropping the treble it is still lacking. Otherwise it's a good tv.

Reviews.Title: This is my second one of these...
Reviews.Author: Beastybunny "Beastybunny"
Reviews.Content: The first one is working like a champ. The new one has a slight hum when I turn it on. I am still messing with settings to see if I can get rid of it. I only really notice first thing in the morning when its quite. Otherwise ambient sound drowns it out. Otherwise this is a great TV.

Reviews.Title: Best gaming led
Reviews.Author: EllisCylde pro gamer
Reviews.Content: Great for gaming im pro. i think this is the best led for the price. Also great for sports and tv

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Viera 32"
Reviews.Author: Native Daughter
Reviews.Content: Ordered on Thursday afternoon, received it on Saturday morning.  Packaged well.  Very easy to set-up (since I have never before set-up a TV).  Picture is outstanding and sound is very good.  I highly recommend this TV.  Amazon is terrific!

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Success!
Reviews.Author: James Carlson
Reviews.Content: After seeing many relatives lose their sony tv's I decided there must be another Brand that strives for quality. We have a panasonic camera that amazed us compared to some of the canon's we had owned and decided to research Panasonic! Excellent decision. The IPS panel is a remarkable technology that puts all of the old style TN screens to shame. You can see a great image from so many different angles It is silly to buy a pivoting wall mount you do not need one! I was very impressed with the construction of the unit all metal casing in back and conservative styling in front. The buttons on the side are a bit hard to reach with small hands. Remote control is a little underwhelming considering the style of the tv itself. Sound is very good too, we can hear the unit clearly from 13 feet away. The LED is wonderful and generates so little heat. If you are in the market for a 32 inch You should really examine this unit or its successors. I will be buying panasonic for a while!

Reviews.Title: Good, basic set with insufficient color controls
Reviews.Author: skst
Reviews.Content: Mounting this on my VESA wall mount was a bit tricky since the inputs are positioned precisely to interfere with the mounting bracket rods. There's only one position that works, and it leaves the mounting rails protruding from the top of the TV set. Of course, your mileage may vary since mounting systems are all different. You may just want to measure things twice to be sure your mounting system will work.The set also seems to be in love with green on the composite input (from my TiVo). Everything has a green tint. Yes, there's a color control, but moving it away from green immediately gives everything too much magenta. I believe I've found an acceptable middle ground or maybe I'm just getting used to it. The cable input (coax) seems to be just fine.I'd like some additional aspect ratio views but I do appreciate the ability to adjust the horizontal and vertical sizes.

Reviews.Title: Awesome tv-easy set up, great pic.
Reviews.Author: Gregory B. Pearson "Nosraep"
Reviews.Content: I added a tv to a large size master, confering with friends, internet, most reccomendations were for 36" or smaller tv. I chose a 32" and could have gone bigger to a 42" but did not want an overwhelming size either.I have a good size master bedroom but this is perfect This 32" is perfect. Easy hook up, easy set up, color awesome. Set u, was easy.size is nice weight, could easily hang on the wall if I decide to move it up.Reccomend, Panasonic is my choice.

Reviews.Title: Highly Recommend
Reviews.Author: TB
Reviews.Content: I am so thrilled with the service Amazon provides.  I ordered my Panasonic on a Wednesday and it arrived the very next day!  The TV was very easy to set up, I love the look of the TV and the picture quality is wonderful.  I highly recommend this TV to anyone.  Thank you, Amazon !

Reviews.Title: Not 1080p and no analog audio out
Reviews.Author: TucsonShopper
Reviews.Content: This 23.5" TV is the smallest I was to buy since the days of CRTs. While it has good color for $200, the resolution is not as sharp as one would expect for 1080p and in fact this resolution is not available to a device connected through the HDMI. This is important for sports, gaming, or use as a PC monitor (you must sit within 30 inches with 20/20 vision to be able to tell). So, I returned mine (yea, free Amazon returns). Note this TV is no longer made so expect this price not to last.The top selling Samsung UN22D5003 22-Inch 1080p Clear Motion Rate 120 LED HDTV (Black) for $180 makes far more sense for the greater sharpness but I wasn't willing to go smaller (note that 22" is only 1.5" less than this 24" because it's really a 23.5" TV) and I had a small concern about the lack of any audio out port. Also noted the Clear Motion is not really a 120Hz scan rate.Another option is the less popular Toshiba 24L4200U 24-Inch 1080p 60Hz LED TV (Black) for $225. There are dual RCA sound outs (although I would also like a headphone jack). The Toshiba is also a half inch larger because it's a true 24 inches. I tried this set next (used, very good condition, for $176). Alas, it has the worst sound from the downward aspect of otherwise fine speakers, the power button is the hardest to find, and colors are very harsh (costing me $30 to return).Then, #1 in DVD-TVs is the Toshiba 24V4210U 24-Inch 1080p 60Hz LED DVD Combo (Black) for $260 which not only has a DVD player but by far the best speakers.
