Who cares if none of these TV supports movies on USB (which would be nice) when this puppy supports DVDs.I had previously purchased a Panasonic TC-L32U3 32-Inch for under $300. I love it but sadly it's no longer readily available (with units now going for $500!). But, there's also last year's VIZIO E3D320VX 32-Inch Class Theater 3D LCD HDTV with Internet Apps for $350 (also supports passive 3D and wifi) but a lot of users complain of reliability issues so I would only buy with the 3rd party $47 4-year extended maintenance. $400 is twice the cost of this TV but I still consider it a better buy. Then again, I think the market for small wireless HDTVs with Internet apps will likely be taken over by the new tablets such as the ASUS TF700T-B1-CG 10.1-Inch Tablet (Champagne), the Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 (10.1-Inch, Wi-Fi), and especially the Microsoft Surface.Finally, if you just want a good 720p TV for watching movies and consider my concerns about this TV as unfounded (say, because you just want to watch movies), you might alternately want to consider the highly rated by CNET TCL L32HDP60 32-Inch 720p LCD HDTV with 2 Year Limited Warranty (Black) for the similar price of $224 (almost $100 less than the 32" version of this TV). It additionally supports more photo and sound formats.While this TV provides a great DVD movie picture (but with no anolog audio out) and Amazon has it for a good price, I ened up returning mine (as there are several that I consider 5-star alternatives - all provide JPG photos and MP3 sound from the USB). Sad, because I am a great fan of Panasonic reliability (I own three other TVs that are all Panasonic). In October 2011, Panasonic announced that it will further trim its money-losing TV business after already cutting 10% of its workforce. I ended up with the Samsung B350 Series T24B350ND 24-Inch Screen LED-Lit Monitor which goes for $215 at Amazon, $199 at Costco, and $190 at LuckyDogElectronics (where I got mine). It has the best picture for computer text, sports, or movies, better than average speakers, and even plays movies through the USB port (besides having a button and controls on the front of the set). I am very happy and hope that I can help you to avoid some of the pain and cost of getting there as well.

Reviews.Title: I'd rather say I'm sad.
Reviews.Author: panda
Reviews.Content: We bought this TV as a Black Friday lightning deal. I was so excited about the deal and I expected good quality since it's Panasonic Viera. But unfortunately I was wrong, especially since I planned to use this as a PC monitor. If you are using it as a TV, however, there is probably nothing wrong with it as a regular TV.1. This TV is labeled "Full HD," but it is not really.I don't really know about LCD-TV technologies, but in comparison to my 2.5 years old 22" LCD-TV (Viore), this LED-LCD is not clear at all. Moreover if I connect the PC with VGA, it supports only up to 1366 x 760. In addition, when I connect this TV with my PC, it broke my video card driver (AMD) and made detection loop. Even though it works as 1080p with an HDMI cable, but the picture is really bad quality and blurry. I can't use it for daily computer use. It will hurt my eyes.My old TV had no problem to be used as a full HD monitor using only a VGA cable.Why? Why did Panasonic make this product this way?2. It has only digital audio output.I can use neither my speaker nor headphone. Who doesn't want analog audio output? 3.5 mm headphone jack is not out of date.I don't really understand why Panasonic made it that way.3. The stand does not let you change the position of the monitor; the monitor is stuck tilted slightly forward.

Reviews.Title: It is a decent tv
Reviews.Author: HGOOD13
Reviews.Content: The tv isn't bad, i got the 24 inch. I didn't know it had only 1 hdmi cable slot, but its fine. I use my tv for movies and gaming so im fine with it. I also thought it was a LED, it is an LCD, not a problem though, just letting everyone know.

Reviews.Title: Good quality picture
Reviews.Author: Dennis P Harrison
Reviews.Content: Good quality picture, great resolution, and good sound.  A great replacement for the old CRT that had been sitting there for 20 years or so.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my kid
Reviews.Author: hopspusher
Reviews.Content: I got this TV for my son, for his room.  This is the perfect size and it is 1080p.  I love and completely trust Panasonic TV's, so there was no question I wanted to buy a Panasonic.  I looked on their website first as well as their closeout website.  Both sites had it listed, but they were not only more expensive, but listed it as out of stock till mid Jan.  I also saw this TV on display at Sears, so I was able to view it and touch it (really light), but they were also more expensive than Amazon.  The TV came within 3 days after ordering it.  I could not be happier.

Reviews.Title: Good TV, Not Great
Reviews.Author: LAB
Reviews.Content: This is a review for the 32 inch TV.  Overall, this TV provides a pretty nice picture, though the HD is not as clear as I've seen it appear on other TVs.  In fact, the HD quality appears clearer on my Insignia 32 inch TV that I purchased in 2008.  The positives are that colors appear pretty vivid on this Panasonic TV, and the channels load very quickly.Another negative is that the picture on this TV appears as though it bends or drags along the sides of the screen, which is most noticible when the camera shot is panning across a scene or landscape.  This isn't too big of a distraction, but it is sometimes noticible.Also, while the description on this site (as well as on Panasonic's website) says this TV is an LED, the box that it came in, as well as the instruction manual, says it's an LCD, so I'm confused about what type of TV I actually received.  I was aiming to buy an LED TV, so I'm disappointed to discover that it might not actually be one.Overall, I think this is a good TV for the price I paid on Amazon, which was over $100 under the retail price.  I don't think the quality of this TV warrants the full retail price though.  In all, I'm pleased with this purchase and am enjoying watching this TV.

Reviews.Title: Good quality TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Thanatos78621
Reviews.Content: Its a very nice TV for the price. The only drawback is the unit has a single HDMI connector, as such I had to connect the cable box via component cables and left/right audio cables.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, I would recomend this to anyone
Reviews.Author: Sergio Blazquez
Reviews.Content: Great Image, great quality, great Colors, I am really happy with this tv, the sound it is perfect the size is just ideal for our room, well all in all I think this is really an oportunity for everyone, good price, plus great quality

Reviews.Title: Why I bought the Panasonic tv with the 24 inch screen
Reviews.Author: lil
Reviews.Content: I wanted a quality tv with a screen that was large enough where I could read the words running below the feature shown in the news and that the tv should still fit on the counter that held my smaller tv. This fits the bill. And the price was reasonable. Delivery was very fast, too.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic TC-L24X5 Handshaking Issues with HDMI
Reviews.Author: drdots
Reviews.Content: I just purchased this 24" TV at a local Fry's. It replaced another Panasonic 22". Both sets have an excellent picture, however the 1080p set won'thandshake through my monoprice 401-xe switch box. It works with my LG BH-200 Combo HD-DVD/Blu Ray player but does not see the Directv signalbox. It works just fine if I connect the Directv box directly but there seems to be a handshake issue when passing the signal from the Directvreceiver thru the switch box. I'd give it more stars if it was not for this issue.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Viera - a quality standard for sure
Reviews.Author: Kenneth L. Myers
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Panasonic Viera 24" LED/LCD HDTV 1080p 720 Mhz flat screen to replace an old bedroom unit.  I already owned a Panasonic Viera Plasma HDTV and knew the quality Panasonic builds into this line of units.  I was not disappointed.  A great picture (easy to adjust), good sound, and the set was very easy to set up and use.  This set is attached to an Antennas Direct DB8 Multidirectional HDTV Antenna in my attic.  We are up to 40 miles from some of the signal sources and receive over 50 digital channels. A brilliant picture easily viewed from across a room, you will not go wrong with this great value from Panasonic. Panasonic VIERA TC-L24X5 24-Inch 1080p Full HD LED LCD TV.

Reviews.Title: Phenomenal
Reviews.Author: Frost Blade
Reviews.Content: Best TV I've Bought. I suggest you buy this TV. It was cheap and well worth the money. It's a pretty good size TV for what I have to do. I give this TV an A+.

Reviews.Title: super little tv
Reviews.Author: Shiba Mom
Reviews.Content: This tv is just the right size to fit into our wall unit. The picture is great!Sound can be improved by connecting to larger speakers. TV can be seen from any angle in the room. This tv has many great features, and the price was low.I would recommend it to anyone who needs a smaller set.

Reviews.Title: Should be advertised as LCD, not LED
Reviews.Author: CESAR MORAIS PALOMO
Reviews.Content: Should have tried it before buying. Plugged my PC via HDMI with 1080p and it has a crappy picture. Colors are terrible, and picture resembles more of a bad quality LCD display rather than a LED one. Bad viewing angle too: even when facing the TV straight from the front, image at corners appearI paid 159,00 for it in a Black Friday deal, otherwise would definitely return it and go for a more expensive but better model.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: R. Casey
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace a Samsung LCD 32" that lasted...18 months. That's how long it took before the hot-running Samsung burned up its power board, causing it to shut off and on at increasingly more frequent intervals...often during the transition from program to commercial and back again. You couldn't even turn if OFF on one try...it would repower up when you hit the ON button...5-6 times before you could get the thing to turn off. Google Samsung LCD and "powers off and on" and you'll see thousands of complaints and a class-action suit...that only covers older, bigger sets.After no help from Samsung, and replacing all the resistors for $100 at a local shop (where they told me LCDs are coming back in like crazy), I went to this Panasonic LED-edge lit set. Our main set for 20 years has been a 32" Panasonic and I've always had good luck with them. So after the Samsung fiasco (we bought it while the big old Panasonic was getting a minor repair), I went back to Panasonic with this set (the 20-year-old one is still kicking). Out of the box, it was easy to set up. The picture is fantastic, better than the LCD sets, IMHO, with strong blacks. ONLY flaw that keeps it from 5 stars...something others mention...the speakers are woefully inadequate. I plan to invest in externals as soon as I figure out how to add them. There's no earphones jack on this set, so you can't go that route. There is a "digital audio output" plug that takes a certain type of cable to connect to a stereo. But I just want to go to powered externals via RCA cables...so not sure how I'm going to do it. All in all, though, I love the set for the price. Fabulous picture...and it doesn't randomly go off and on. Great.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic TC-L24x5
Reviews.Author: a. nanny mouse
Reviews.Content: I use this product to receive OTA TV programs and as a computer monitor. The quality of the picture is very good. The sound is good for a small TV. The drawback to this product is the lack of inputs. There is only one HDMI input and one component input. So, if you have more then one device you either have to constantly switch the cables or buy a switch box. When used as a OTA TV the reception is good and I am able to receive stations 70 miles distant. But unfortunately the TV does not allow the addition of new channels without doing a setup scan. So, every time the antenna is changed a new scan is required.Pro: Good picture, ease of set up, sensitive tuner for distant stations, light weight and slim design.Con: no add new channels feature, no program info displayed on screen, lack of inputs.I gave this TV 3 stars because of the inability to add new channels without a new scan every time the antenna position is changed.Also Panasonic no longer has this unit on their website. The move is to larger screen tv's.

Reviews.Title: Beware - Time zone not adjustable
Reviews.Author: gnr
Reviews.Content: This TV reads the time slot of the program you are watching at the top of the TV.  This time slot is only accurate in the Eastern time zone and IS NOT ADJUSTABLE.  I sent several emails back and forth as well as making two 1-hour phone calls to Panasonic Customer Service.  I was first given a procedure to follow to reset the TV that was supposed to fix the issue.  It turns out that the instructions they gave me were not for this TV.  The reset procedure is a menu item on this TV and that did nothing to fix the TV.  Then I was lied to on my first call as the agent said they would escalate the issue to another dept. and they would get back with me in 48 hours.  I waited a week and no response so I had to call again and make another 1 hour call.The net result......they said this TV doesn't have and adjustable time zone "FEATURE" and there is nothing they will do to fix it.  That is like saying you bought a car where the speedometer only works in one part of the country.If you are going to call this a feature and this TV doesn't have it, then they should just leave the time zone off entirely.  At least that makes sense.  But showing the wrong time zone and not being able to adjust it DOES NOT MAKE SENSE.I also own a 42" Panasonic TV and have been happy with it for the most part.  The speakers are junky but that is somewhat normal on most flat panel TVs.  But after this experience with my 24", I will never buy another Panasonic again.

Reviews.Title: Image on Amazon doesn't match product received
Reviews.Author: David Williams
Reviews.Content: I'm happy with the TV overall but I selected it specifically because the image showed 3 HDMI ports but the TV actually only has one HDMI port.

Reviews.Title: Not Impressed
Reviews.Author: Seth Pegg
Reviews.Content: You get your moneys worth. Its a mid-ranged quality tv. I have been having trouble getting the full 1080p to work.

Reviews.Title: So far, it's good.
Reviews.Author: Dona L. Johnson "Tax Goddess"
Reviews.Content: I have had the television for about a month.  The only problem I have had so far is that I cannot get the volume to go up as loud as I want.  I like to hear the news while in the shower and blow drying my hair.  So, that being said, the volume is adequate for normal viewing.  I would just like it to be louder :D

Reviews.Title: HOW TO SOLVE YOUR AUDIO PROBLEM
Reviews.Author: AGNAZZO
Reviews.Content: I bought a Panasonic TV from Best Buy (TC L 32X ) It was almost 100 dollars more expensive than I purchased from Amazon.I'm not complaining, Best buy gave me valuable information about the ports I needed to accommodate the devices (4 in all ) and they supplied an information booth to answer any puzzling problem I may have. Enough of that.I had a problem in trying to find out how to connect my external amplifier to this TV. I finally found out that Panasonic has only one port and it is digital and I needed Analog. This product ( Menotek Digital Audio To Analog Audio Converter )  gives the solution to that problem. I ordered it from Amazon and along with the proper cables (not supplied) and come with a package deal from Amazon solved my problem. The output analog from this device hooked up to my amplifier is not controllable from the TV. I can recommend this product for anyone who bought the Panasonic TV listed above

Reviews.Title: A 1080p TV that is really 768
Reviews.Author: RLV
Reviews.Content: I was about to buy this on a CyberMonday lightning deal for $159 until I took the advice of the other reviewers and looked up the specs on Panasonic's website: [...]The display is not physically a 1080p display. You will notice under the link that the physical display is only 1,366 x 768 pixels, so at 768 it is slightly better than 720, but no where near the marketed 1080.This product seems like a bad Dilbert cartoon:Dilbert: We're better than 720p. We're 768 lines.Dogbert: Great, we'll sell it as 1080p.Dilbert: But we're not 1080 lines.Dogbert: Doesn't matter. Who looks at the specs? And if they do, what are they going to do?Dilbert: But, isn't it wrong to lie to the customer?Dogbert: Yes, but it's more profitable.I'm in the market for a smaller TV, but after discovering this marketing sleight-of-hand I will not, under any circumstances, consider a Panasonic.

Reviews.Title: Won't Pick Up HD channels with antenna
Reviews.Author: J. SNIADECKI
Reviews.Content: Canceled cable and wanted to replace our one tv that does not have tv tuner built in it. This tv will not pick up hd channels with antenna. Tried help desk and they could not get it to work. Returned for refund.

Reviews.Title: Under 1080P. Not intended as a PC Monitor
Reviews.Author: Sean Benton
Reviews.Content: While this TV may work great for "entertainment" purposes, it is not suitable for use as a computer monitor. My reason for saying so is that, while it is listed as 1080p and will work at 1080p, the highest recommended resolution for a PC Connection (specifically HDMI or VGA/D-Sub) is  1366x768, which is at least four levels below 1080p resolution. [This is directly from the manual under page 21 Input Signal Compatibility Chart]. I can attest that it does function and properly scale at 1920x1080 via HDMI connection, however all text is fuzzy and difficult to read. I've been using 1680x1050 for years and so this is not just an aversion to change I've got. My intent with purchasing this set was to use it as a third monitor on my work/school/gaming computer, but alas it won't be staying there as I have not want for a monitor that can't properly display text.I've calibrated the system and changed all sorts of settings but it is clearly laid out the set is not designed for 1080p from a PC.Luckily I got this set for free as part of a purchase of a 55" Panasonic, so I'm not out anything and I'm not upset with it, just a bit disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Pore qaulity from Panasonic
Reviews.Author: A. J. Beaudry
Reviews.Content: Much smaller screen than I expected.  Sound was not right and the color, with some, programs was off.  I will not buy from Panasonic

Reviews.Title: Warning - 24X5 is 720p, look at Pansonic site specs
Reviews.Author: Deux Bits "These go to Eleven"
Reviews.Content: **Amazon/Panasonic Description Mistake** Scroll down to the Panasonic specs on the page, you will see that the 24X5 is incorrectly described by Amazon as 1080p. The 32X5 is 1080p, not the 24X5 which is 720p. Note that if you search for the TV on Panasonic's website,[...]you will find that it is also incorrectly described by Panasonic as a 1080p HDTV, BUT if you look at the resolution in the specs you will see that it cannot possibly be a native 1080p device. The panel only displays 1366x768 = 720p. 24" true 1080p HDTVs are rare.

Reviews.Title: Misleading specs: Good TV, but no 1080p support in PC input mode
Reviews.Author: deer 224
Reviews.Content: I bought this 24" 1080p HDTV as a dual use TV/monitor. The image quality and display are very soothing to the eye. However it doesn't support 1080p resolution in PC mode. This was not mentioned in the specs. It's mentioned in the manual though. I can't understand why Panasonic doesn't support 1080p when a similar but very low priced "Haier" HDTV would. It was useless to me and I had to jump through hoops to get a return shipping  label authorized!The one star is for misleaded specs!

Reviews.Title: Review on Amazon description, NOT on TV
Reviews.Author: Jessie
Reviews.Content: Got this on lightning deal for cyber monday week, and just received it today.NO it is not LED!Don't get fooled by Amazon's description!I contacted Amazon customer service to chat and there was NOTHING they could do for me! Don't waste your time on this, now I have to repack this and return it. Ugh.

Reviews.Title: 24" review. One star is too much.
Reviews.Author: Keevan Abramson
Reviews.Content: Poor picture quality. Sound even at maximum, not very loud(couldn't hear it while exercising on an elliptical trainer). Great packaging which was good as I sent it back. Maybe I just got a bad one as I have a 32" Panasonic which is great.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic VIERA TC-L24X5 24-Inch 1080p
Reviews.Author: Douglas
Reviews.Content: Unit has very poor resolution, despite its 720p and 1080p advertised claims. Picture is fuzzy and in many cases, lacks detail and sharpness. This does not happen with comparable Samsung's that we also own. I would not buy or recommend this product again. Unfortunately we are past the Amazon 30 day return policy. Should have bought from another dealer where a full refund would have been available beyond 30 days instead of Amazon's 50%.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic is in TROUBLE!
Reviews.Author: T Rex "Dr. Floyd"
Reviews.Content: Panasonic VIERA TC-L24X5 24-Inch 1080p Full HD LED LCD TVThis is a case of mistaken identity. Panasonic has long been identified as having a phenominal brand. I have purchased at least 100 electronics items from Panasonic over the years and know people within Panasonic who do their TV product development. For this TV set I cannot wait to ask them what happened.I purchased this set to replace the one my daughter took to college. The only redeeming quality this TV has, is that it looks stylish as it is very slender and all black with no gaudy insignias all over the face of the bezel. The compliments STOP there.Sound is awfulPicture is awfulColors are mutedTracing lines show up on any screen motionDON'T buy this TV or you will be sending it back, as I am today.

Reviews.Title: it's going back to best buy
Reviews.Author: santa fe
Reviews.Content: i just bought this 32 inch set and very disappointed with the picture.  amazingly, the white westinghouse set that i purchased at a black friday sale five years ago has redder reds and overall a much better picture and sound.i have a 56 inch panasonic plasma which is the best tv set ever, but this led does not come close in its picture and sound quality.the set was manufactured just last month and i would have expected that the panasonic brand would have provided a qualitative performance.  it doesn't

Reviews.Title: Not a bargain
Reviews.Author: Customer #?
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews,I ordered the Panasonic  TC-L24X5.Sounded like a good tv and the price was good.set it up and tried to get a good picture but just couldn't get a clear picture.tried it for a few days and then the sound just stopped.No sound ,Bad pic-back it went! Amazon is good about shipping and returns,they make it easy.I'll try another brand.

Reviews.Title: Picture Quality/Clarity
Reviews.Author: Noel
Reviews.Content: I have Two Panasonic 42in plasma TV's and am very satisfied with them, plus have had other Panasonic products. I am not really satisfied with the 24 inch Panasonic Tv. I installed it in my motorhome and unless you view the Tv straight on you pick up a glazed picture (Like frosting). I contacted Panasonic and they referred me to a warranty repair shop in Denver and they checked it and told me my problem was normal with the smaller screen TV. I had just installed a 32 inch Samsung Tv in the front of the motorhome and get a great picture. I'll have to live wth The 24in Panasonic but based on this experience I will have to think real hard before purchasing another Panasonic product.

Reviews.Title: sent it back becuase it did not meet expectations.
Reviews.Author: Rose Holland
Reviews.Content: The TV worked but it was too small for the space where it was suppose to be sitting.  I should have known better.

Reviews.Title: Sound off
Reviews.Author: Betty M. Wang-Garcia
Reviews.Content: The sound quality was horrible (like talking into a tin can). Following the advice of another Amazon reviewer for this product, we bought a sound bar to hook to it. Didn't help and actually got worse. There was an irritating loud hum coming from the sound bar.  We thought the sound bar was defective, so we hooked it onto another LED TV. Nope. It was definitely the Panasonic HDTV. Sent it back to Amazon, but wanted to still give Panasonic another chance thinking "hmmm maybe it was just this one unit was defective." Got the same model from Amazon and amazingly the sound on the 2nd exact same model was EVEN WORSE!!!  Send the 2nd Panasonic back and order a non-Panasonic brand LED HDTV.

Reviews.Title: Not an LED!
Reviews.Author: Chrisw
Reviews.Content: The Amazon description shows it is a LED. It is not. It is an LCD only as per the box and the picture is not very clear. I saw this exact TV model number in Sears but the Amazon is not the same product. The picture doesn't fit the whole screen without being distorted. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Significant input lag. "Game Mode" is a fake
Reviews.Author: Jared B
Reviews.Content: My primary reason for purchasing this TV was for gaming. I previously purchased a Panasonic P42ST30 (Plasma) TV from Amazon, and the input lag is more than bearable on that set. I needed a smaller set for gaming in another room, and everyone I spoke to recommended that I stick with Panasonic if my primary concern was input lag. Even though this is an LED-LCD set, I read that the IPS displays have the least amount of lag when it comes to non-plasma TVs, and the size and price were right for me, so I ordered it. Within an hour of plugging it in, I was packing it back up to return it.First off, there is no "Game Mode." The only game mode to speak of is an image adjustment preset (brightness, color balance, etc.) called GAME. This setting does not disable any image pre-processing, and only changes the look. The input latency was immediately noticeable. After looking through every menu on the TV and disabling every image enhancement that I was able to, the TV was still laggy (though not as much). The lack of an actual Game Mode was a huge disappointment. I would not have even considered this TV had I known that the advertised Game Mode did nothing at all to reduce input lag.As far as for non-gaming uses, I couldn't really say. As soon as I discovered how poor this TV is for gaming I decided to pack it up and return it right away. Look elsewhere for a gaming TV.

Reviews.Title: This is not 1920 x 1080 for PC
Reviews.Author: Donnie D'Amato
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a monitor for my PC, thinking that it would be 1920 x 1080 for the computer.  It is not, the highest resolution is 1366 x 768.  It seems many TVs are like this, except for the Westinghouse LD2240, but I also don't recommend that one either as I am in the midst of sending that in for repair for a flickering screen.

Reviews.Title: It SUCKS !!!
Reviews.Author: Karl
Reviews.Content: This tv is HORRIBLE! The picture is very dim, the colors are yellowish no matter how much you adjust it, and the sound is non-existent. I returned it for a full refund. Don't be fooled by the positive reviews like I was; I don't know what those people are looking at, or maybe they have no experience with televisions (I have a 32",720p,120hz,Cfl backlight,5year old Sony that blows this tv out of the water;and I have a Samsung,46",1080p,240hz,3d,led,tv that's the best I've ever seen) but this tv SUCKS!. I also found it to be too small for the bedroom;if you're looking for a 32" bedroom tv try a 40"-42",Samsung,Sony,or LG,120hz,you'll thank me.
